name: lubriciousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour that shows too great an interest in sex, especially in an unpleasant way: He sees a connection between war and lubriciousness, a prurient quality in violence. He sings the song with a kind of swaggering lubriciousness. See
lubricious
More examplesFewer examplesIn this short scene, he somehow combines lubriciousness, warmth, and vulnerability.The parts of Dracula’s vampire brides are danced with splendid lubriciousness.He promoted his new endeavours with the hard-edged lubriciousness sought shock value in nudity.
